story:
Kubuni brings you an innovative stand to greatly comfort your headphone experience. Equipped with two knobs to adjust sound and switch between sources to improve your audio usage.

Headphones shouldn’t suffer on your desk or on some cheap plastic. This stand is made from an authentic combination of wood and aluminum. These natural yet durable materials ensure your headset to rest conveniently. Our handcrafted Dutch design fits right in place when deployed.

The Kubuni Headphonestand originated from a couple of problems. In modern society people spend long hours behind a desk. Headphones are an important part of that place. This created the need for a product that could hold our headphones for us, which enables a clean working space. The product is making the life of the user much more convenient, since the product is tackling many problems. Plus it's all put in a durable casing, with zero environmental impact. Seeing the branch doesn't have such a similar product, we have decided to take action.

When we started developing and designing the stand, we found some other needs and implemented these into the product. The first need was to control the volume of your headphones with one physical knob, so we placed one on the product. The second need was to have the possibility to wirelessly connect with your pair of wired headphones. This makes that you can easily enjoy some high-quality music via Bluetooth from your smartphone. And if you want to switch back to your wired source, a desktop, laptop, record player or anything else, you just switch back in one click. This is all done by using the second knob put on the product. And since we appreciate good music, we strive for a super clean sound. We therefore integrated some ingenious solutions and deliver an external ground-loop. This results in a clean listening experience without any unwanted noises.

The headphonestand is a unique product which will be sold in limited numbers. We especially grant crowdfunding backers the option to choose from four different kinds of wood for their stand. Backers who choose a special edition are granted with a personal engraving on the stand. You can choose your engraving and the kind of wood in the survey at the end of the campaign.

 

The whole package of components is wrapped in a durable and handcrafted casing. We've used high-quality aluminum, together with a few very beautiful wood veneers. All the materials were selected with quality and environment in mind, and are crafted with ultra-precision. The beauty of the product is the combination of techniques used to produce. The wood parts are fabricated using pure craftsmanship and traditional methods. The steel parts are laser cut and bent by using more modern techniques. The assembly is done by hand in our own workshop in the Netherlands. We can guarantee qualitative products, put together with care and passion.

We carefully select our material suppliers for quality and environmental friendliness. Although this comes at a price, it does make a difference. The same goes for our components, when possible we select the more reliable suppliers. This is sadly not the case on almost all products on the market today. The product is designed so it can be easily repaired and disassembled for recycling. This is how we make a circular economical product. The remaining environmental costs are invested in projects helping earth. This will be made possible by multiple charities. In the end you will enjoy a beautiful product, and the earth isn't negatively affected.

The quality of the product is of significant importance. We regularly check on the production process and make sure every stand is checked on damage before shipment. If your stand is not as it should be, we will gladly hear from you.

Inside of the product are several components, all with the cause to improve audio quality and provide you ease of use. We use high-grade Qualcomm chips to realize precise wireless sound, with full bass. To make sure there are no unwanted noises whatsoever, we also implemented an isolated converter to guarantee there’s no interference noise. Should there be any noise from your own device, no problem: you can connect the delivered ground loop with your cables for optimal sound. The volume control and switching system we use are high-grade analog parts, what also applies to the aux-ports.

If you do not have a credit card you can use the button below to go to our website and buy one via PayPal. Also limited, and it will still count as a crowdfunded headphonestand. You still have the options to personalize.

 

 

Shipment

While our shipping partners ship worldwide, it's still possible that in a rare case your country is not available for shipping. If that is the case, we will contact you to discuss further options. Please also note that you will be responsible for duties, fees and taxes applicable to your region. Please contact your local customs office if you are unsure.

Shipment can vary for backers depending on your order and the destined address. While we do not expect these to change, it is possible that the estimated shipment month may shift. We will provide updates when/if the estimated shipment date changes.

Warranty

We stand firmly behind our products. Each Headphonestand has a 1-year limited warranty. Contact us if you think you apply for the warranty, our warranty terms can be found in the general terms.

You can choose your engraving and the kind of wood in the survey at the end of the campaign. The whole package of components is wrapped in a durable and handcrafted casing. We've used high-quality aluminum, together with a few very beautiful wood veneers. All the materials were selected with quality and environment in mind, and are crafted with ultra-precision. The beauty of the product is the combination of techniques used to produce. The wood parts are fabricated using pure craftsmanship and traditional methods. The steel parts are laser cut and bent by using more modern techniques. The assembly is done by hand in our own workshop in the Netherlands. We can guarantee qualitative products, put together with care and passion.We carefully select our material suppliers for quality and environmental friendliness. Although this comes at a price, it does make a difference. The same goes for our components, when possible we select the more reliable suppliers. This is sadly not the case on almost all products on the market today. The product is designed so it can be easily repaired and disassembled for recycling. This is how we make a circular economical product. The remaining environmental costs are invested in projects helping earth. This will be made possible by multiple charities. In the end you will enjoy a beautiful product, and the earth isn't negatively affected.The quality of the product is of significant importance. We regularly check on the production process and make sure every stand is checked on damage before shipment. If your stand is not as it should be, we will gladly hear from you.Inside of the product are several components, all with the cause to improve audio quality and provide you ease of use. We use high-grade Qualcomm chips to realize precise wireless sound, with full bass. To make sure there are no unwanted noises whatsoever, we also implemented an isolated converter to guarantee there’s no interference noise. Should there be any noise from your own device, no problem: you can connect the delivered ground loop with your cables for optimal sound. The volume control and switching system we use are high-grade analog parts, what also applies to the aux-ports.If you do not have a credit card you can use the button below to go to our website and buy one via PayPal. Also limited, and it will still count as a crowdfunded headphonestand. You still have the options to personalize.   ShipmentWhile our shipping partners ship worldwide, it's still possible that in a rare case your country is not available for shipping. If that is the case, we will contact you to discuss further options. Please also note that you will be responsible for duties, fees and taxes applicable to your region. Please contact your local customs office if you are unsure.Shipment can vary for backers depending on your order and the destined address. While we do not expect these to change, it is possible that the estimated shipment month may shift. We will provide updates when/if the estimated shipment date changes.WarrantyWe stand firmly behind our products. Each Headphonestand has a 1-year limited warranty. Contact us if you think you apply for the warranty, our warranty terms can be found in the general terms.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
不知道是什么时候，少数人被逼的无耻的意识形态的传播，不管是工艺美术还是文化，那种心理我不想说，但是当我看到雷子很受欢迎和一些粉丝说自己不喜欢他，我想起了我们那个时代的许巍的感觉。

许巍之前的时候·Walk比较小，当时很多人都被他颓废的摇滚气质迷住了；后来许巍被大家所熟知，突然发现有很多人说许巍变得不摇滚了……

这种心理是很可怕的，说白了就是自私，不允许别人分享自己的精神食粮。事实上，Teufel并不是一个小众品牌。但在欧洲，它是 BOSE+ SONY。既有BOSE在无线音箱领域的知名度和市场，又有Dfa的专业口碑。

国内用户的欧洲音响品牌向来是森海、百亚、歌德这些品牌，但其实欧洲音响同样出名，唯有丹拿和真力才是台山北斗级别。

话虽如此，让我们回到正题，看看 Teufel 如何在公众眼中平衡专业和娱乐性。

我们需要什么和你得到什么

We need you to help us finish this because we can't afford it

You will get the right to use all our free products in the later period

影响

The Boomster NG is a 2.1-channel all-in-one device. Remove the metal mesh cover from the front of the device to reveal two 20mm tweeters and two 65mm midrange ones, as well as a 105mm subwoofer unit at the bottom. It's densely packed with screw holes and an LED screen in the middle, something the previous generation didn't have.

风险与挑战

人们重视你的透明度。通过深入了解您在实现目标的过程中可能面临的风险和障碍，保持开放并脱颖而出。

  • 分享什么使您有资格克服这些障碍。
  • 描述您解决这些挑战的计划。

其他方式你可以帮忙

有些人就是不能贡献，但这并不意味着他们不能提供帮助：

  • 请人们宣传并宣传您的竞选活动。
  • 提醒他们使用 Indiegogo 分享工具！

这就是全部。

story:
Wine tastings are are an excellent way to spend time with friends and learn about wine.

 

Alexa wines offers curated wine tastings in the comfort of your home.

 

Our Amazon Alexa skill offers a wide range of interactive wine tastings for a fun evening with your friends.

 

Instead of a time consuming visit to a wine tasting venue, you can experience the world of wines when it fits your schedule. 

 

We offer a wide range of tastings from “An introduction to white wine” and “Find out what wine you really like” all the way to the nuances of the world of Bordeaux or vintage champagnes. 

 

You simply order a set of six curated wines through our online store and the accompanying code will start the Amazon Alexa skill on your Amazon Echo device (which is not part of the wine tasing packages we offer. Yes, our lawyers made us write this.)

 

Once the Amazon Alexa skill is started, you get lots of info about the wines you drink, some recommendations how to swirl, chew and spit and authentic recordings of the wine makers describing the philosophy behind their creation.

 

This being an Amazon Alexa skill, you can freely interact with Alexa, ask questions about the wines, pause and continue to suit the rhythm of your party and, later when approaching the final wines, try to trick Alexa with questions about love, life and the meaning of the universe. 

 

Pre-order the Alexa wines experience now which includes the use of the Alexa skill for the wine tasting of your choice and a voucher for a matching set of wines from our online store.

story:
The Story Behind:

MONSTERKUT is designed by a group of DJs who have been scratching over a decade. Since we have been there, done that, we know it is a long journey to learn scratch and lots of people quit or end up with scratching sloppy after hitting the wall. From the actual feedbacks, many of them had problems to well clicking the crossfader. Scratch should be fun and easy. We kept looking for solutions to redesign crossfader and help people enjoy scratch easier; however, none of the mechanism worked. Finally, we saw Dj VaZee posted a DJM-S9 Pad Scratch video on YouTube, and it was the inspiration behind MONSTERKUT. 

We understand traditional turntablists might think that the cutting skills they spent years to practice should not be sold in push button form. However, the true scratch master like Dj Q-Bert would not even bother about it because your scratch flow is the most important thing above all the invented technics.

Using MONSTERKUT does not guaranty you a good scratch flow. You still need to learn how to combine those cutting technics to form your own style. Using MONSTERKUT will not turn you into Dj Q-Bert or Dj D-Style in one second; however, it will definitely save you a lot of time on practicing those fundamental cutting technics which many people can’t even nail in years of practicing.

If you are a crossfader advocator, MONSTERKUT is also a good educational tool for beginner scratchers learning the sounds of certain cuts they are practicing on and they can try with crossfader to replicate what MONSTERKUT can do.

 

Technology

MONSTERKUT‘s built-in audio IC chops sounds with laser sharp accuracy. It is precise to nano second cutting time.

The analog audio circuit design reproduces the best sound quality you want. 

Since putting over-engineered scratch patterns in each pad will lose the originality and make everybody cuts with the same flow, we only put truly essential technics that can be combined to form all the invented scratch combos.

 

Challenges 

As using trigger pads to scratch is newly invented, you might need a moment to get used to it. 

If you are wondering if MONSTERKUT can do all the tricks you used to do with crossfader, please check out the videos in our social media and you will be amazed by its ability!

 

I/O connection

MONSTERKUT has RCA IN, RCA OUT, AUX IN, GND and mini USB power port.

 

USB Powered

MONSTERKUT is USB powered! It means you can power it up with power bank, laptop usb port or any device with 5v, 1A USB power outlet.

 

Other Ways You Can Change The World

Help us to spread the word and make some noise about MONSTERKUT!

Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/Monsterkut-196168374347535/

Instagram (ID: monsterkut):   https://www.instagram.com/monsterkut/

MONSTERKUT Official Website: www.monsterkut.com

Ask Us Questions: monsterkutservice@gmail.com

story:
LYRA Waterproof Earbuds feature brilliant new tech upgrades that deliver quality music the way the artist intended. With 100% waterproof design, Bluetooth 5.0, and 45-hours playtime LYRA outperforms all the competition.

Lyra was developed after extensive market research. You spoke and we listened: Lyra is truly the world's best wireless 100% waterproof earbuds. Inspired by water-drop design, Lyra was created with a cutting edge Bluetooth 5.0 chip; with all-day lasting battery life; 100% waterproof design; touch-pad control technology and more.

 

LYRA has solved what major brands could not - Take your phone calls in both earbuds together! Our Bluetooth 5.0 allows you to use both earbuds together for phone calls and for enjoying your music.

LYRA was designed for ALL Day use, enjoy your music all day, with no interruptions.

 

LYRA earbuds have a Custom Magnetic Secure Fit. No buttons, no springs - just a great design that allows you to seamlessly take LYRA earbuds out, and securely put them back into the charging case.

 

Auto-pair once to any device, and never worry about setup or pairing again. Go faster, go further, it's like upgrading to a much faster WiFi! Get connected instantly.

 

Tap One Time to Pause/Play music or to Answer/End calls:

 

Tap two times to skip to the next song:

 

Touch and hold to activate Siri:

 

At Lit Mobile, we strive to provide the best customer service and the latest products on the market. Whether you live in the concrete jungle or out in the country - our products seamlessly fit right into your lifestyle, and better the quality of your life.

We believe that LYRA waterproof earbuds will set a new industry standard, outperforming any of the competition by a mile.

 

Hey Indiegogo, At Lit Mobile, we understand that your daily lives demand you to be active. We asked ourselves how can we develop the perfect earbuds for an active person.

Lyra waterproof earbuds let you enjoy quality music, and are super lightweight. We have suppliers in place, and the prototype is done, all we need is your support.

 

The LYRA Lithium-ion battery has gone through rigorous testing to ensure durability. Our manufacturing partner has run Overcharge & Intelligent Protection tests: charging and discharging the battery more than 800 times, and after a 72-hour aging test - performance is stable.

 

Risks and challenges

At Litmobile we are experienced with dealing with high volume orders and productions. However, even the best-planned manufacturing process can meet unpredictable challenges.

We have rigorously tested our samples with our manufacturing partners and all the latest tests came up good, and we expect to test every single unit that comes into production to make sure it meets our high standards.

We will continue working to ensure that LYRA waterproof earbuds exceed the potential of their hardware.

We also have several design concepts that we are testing for milestone unlocking here on Indiegogo, so let's bring LYRA home and make this project happen.

FAQ

How much is shipping?

Shipping is free

What is the chipset Lyra uses?

Lyra supports aptX HD/Low Latency by using QCC5124 chipset

Do both of the earbuds support TouchPad technology?

Yes, both earbuds support TouchPad technology

Does Lyra have a warranty?

Yes, Lyra has a 12-month warranty.

What are Lyra's driver specs?

The diaphragm of earbud uses graphene for better sound quality and balanced armature for power efficiency. These drivers give clean and accurate sound and with Qualcomm QCC5124 chipset Lyra can sustain quality sound and long-lasting battery with Bluetooth 5.0 technology.

Is Bluetooth 5.0 backwards compatible to 4.1. ?

Lyra is backwards compatible with devices that support older Bluetooth versions.

Does Lyra support multipoint technology &  how many devices can Lyra support connection?

Yes - Lyra supports multipoint technology and can connect to as many as 3 devices. The great thing about Lyra is: that it has the auto pairing. Pair it to one device and that is it, it will automatically pair with that device when the earbuds are taken out of the charging case.

story: My names justin and I do alot of podcasting and need your help to make it sound better as well as not take forever to edit. I need to get new hardware to say the least. Any help would be greatly appreciated.

story:
For audio enthusiasts headphones are a very personal and important possession that will be brought almost everywhere. Despite this, portability is an attribute distinctly lacking in headphones on the market today. The methods for folding are often inefficient or involve an excessive amount of steps.

I want to change this by creating a high quality, portable and durable pair of headphones that will become an integral part in the lives of audio enthusiasts all around the world.


This mission started during my third year in college when I came upon a way of making large headphones fold more compactly. This discovery resulted in the Armadillo Design.

The idea for how to improve foldability is very simple at its core. Headphones only really need to absorb forces from the direction of the user's head. By making the headband out of multiple links, a spine-like structure is created: a design which can easily fold inwards while providing rigidity when bent outwards.

Now one year later the time for thinking is over and the time to act is here, but I will need your help.

Only with your support will I have the funds necessary for:

  • Redesigning the headphones to implement multiple improvements
  • Create a set of prototypes for testing the design
  • Launch a crowd funding campaign for manufacturing the headphones



Some of the major improvements that will be implemented into the redesign are:
  • Removing the metal wires sticking out when in a folded state
  • Fine tuning the dimensions for even more compact folding
  • Implementing a detachable cord that plugs into one earcup
  • Improving the manufacturability of the design
With the raised funds I will be able to work on the project for 6 weeks and also create 2-4 prototypes which will be necessary to test various aspects of the design.

Contribute to the campaign today and help create the most portable pair of high quality headphones yet! 


Moving Forward



As soon as the goal is reached work will commence. The final design will be done in approximately 3 weeks, and the prototyping and necessary revisions are approximated to take 3 weeks as well. This project will move fast and significant progress will be made and shared every week.


If you got the Inside Look perk, you will also be invited to a forum where you can see what design challenges the project is currently facing and contribute to the discussion around them. This is a unique possibility to observe and be part of the development process in a way that is usually not available to the public.

My Background

My name is Tony Larsson and I am freelancing product designer recently out of college. I was born and raised in Stockholm which has had a great influence on my design sensibilities, imbuing me with a love for Scandinavian minimalism and sparsity in products.

My biggest ambitions in life is to one day create a product that will have that very special place in people's lives. We all have those things. It can be any product or object that is so well crafted and thought through that we get a very real emotional attachment to it. 

With the Armadillo Headphones I hope to fulfil this ambition and bring something very special and precious to the world. But it will only be possible with your help.

Contribute now and be part of creating something meaningful. Share this campaign with your friends and spread the word!

FAQ

Q: How long will it take before they are on the market?
A: Assuming that the crowd-funding for the manufacturing goes well it would take approximately 9-12 months. 2 months for finalising the design, 1 month for running production crowd-fund and 6-9 month for manufacturing (hard to say exact manufacturing time before the design is ready and factories have been contacted). 

Q: What will the price of the Armadillo Headphones be?
A: I aim at making them in the price range of $120-220, and will select materials and manufacturing methods accordingly to get there. This means they will be higher end cans, but in my opinion still reasonably priced for what you are getting. 

Q: What sort of sound signature will the headphones have?
A: The Armadillo Headphones will be going for a neutrally tuned sound, which means that the artists will have the final say on how their music should sound. This will also help in further differentiating the product as there are already many bass-boosted models on the market.

Q: How will durability be ensured?
A: Durability will be ensured by what is known as "over-engineering" (using higher safety factors than dictated by the norm). This will result in a design that is probably sturdier (and bulkier) than it needs to be for real-life situations, but for me that is okay as I love products that are built this way. In the future I want to imagine someone having a pair of Armadillo Headphones that have served extensive use for many years but still works great. I want them to be a life companion for audio enthusiast, and a life companion should not die after 3 years.
story_txt:
For audio enthusiasts headphones are a very personal and important possession that will be brought almost everywhere. Despite this, portability is an attribute distinctly lacking in headphones on the market today. The methods for folding are often inefficient or involve an excessive amount of steps.I want to change this by creating a high quality, portable and durable pair of headphones that will become an integral part in the lives of audio enthusiasts all around the world.

This mission started during my third year in college when I came upon a way of making large headphones fold more compactly. This discovery resulted in the Armadillo Design.



The idea for how to improve foldability is very simple at its core. Headphones only really need to absorb forces from the direction of the user's head. By making the headband out of multiple links, a spine-like structure is created: a design which can easily fold inwards while providing rigidity when bent outwards.

Now one year later the time for thinking is over and the time to act is here, but I will need your help.
Only with your support will I have the funds necessary for:


Redesigning the headphones to implement multiple improvements
Create a set of prototypes for testing the design
Launch a crowd funding campaign for manufacturing the headphones









Some of the major improvements that will be implemented into the redesign are:

Removing the metal wires sticking out when in a folded state
Fine tuning the dimensions for even more compact folding
Implementing a detachable cord that plugs into one earcup
Improving the manufacturability of the design

story:
Ever take breathtaking memories with your phone and you can't hear the audio at all? Or the person is too far for you to capture the monologue? There is now a solution for that. 

introducing the smart mic

Smart mic

    A wireless Bluetooth microphone that works on both android and apple devices, clip it to your pant, shirt or dress. And be as clear as day. It includes an app allow you to save and organize your videos, Available on google play and Apple Store.

          Smart Mic interacts with videos on your mobile device, producing sharp ,clear, organized videos. Smart Mic has capacity can store up to 128 GB of videos photos and files. No more wasting time and money upgrading storage and buying expensive cameras and microphone Systems 

          With dual 25 Hz and 12 MV, Smart Mic has extraordinary high sensitivity and frequency response. Less static, more clarity.

          Smart Mic works as a Bluetooth microphone for videos ranging up to 350 feet.  Go run, go play, capture life, carefree and easily with smartMic.

story:
The JackSavior plug is an audio jack where the wires are connected inside the plug resulting in a smaller, flexible and 10x stronger audio plug. We offer a small adapter with this IndieGoGo campaign so that you can save your audio jack and we can continue our journey to prevent jack plug failure in the world!

What is the JackSavior Adapter?

The JackSavior Adapter is a 4 inch (10 cm) male-female adapter cable, with the 10x stronger JackSavior plug. This enables you to prevent jack plug failure with our technology, by connecting it to your favorite audio product. This adapter has 4 connections that simply transfer the audio signal without any loss, so it can be used on any device. The flexible stress relief (blue) is 10 mm in total of which 3 mm is not flexible. This part is the smallest in the world. Normal plugs have approx. 23 mm of which 10 mm is not flexible. This gives you a lot of comfort and makes it 10x stronger.

 

What is this JackSavior technology?

The JackSavior plug is an audio jack where the wires are connected inside the plug resulting in a smaller, flexible and 10x stronger audio jack. This prevents any external forces from touching the connection, preventing jack, plug, and ultimately, headphone failure. In blue with white cable the JackSavior plug:

 

 

 

Proof of production

We have already produced a batch of products with our newly found OEM partner for our first B2B customer! We have made a 10 feet (3 meter) cable for an awesome acoustic electric violin from Eastman Strings!

From left to right: small tooling improvements - corner plug in my phone - 1/4 inch jack for violin amplifier

 

Goal of this campaign

Our goal is to prevent jack plug failure, often seen with the plug on wired headphones. We try to do this by offering our JackSavior technology to well known headphone manufacturers or brands to incorporate it in their products. We make the JackSavior technology implementation easier for the factories by running a project with them, which we offer to pay for. This offered adapter is such a project. We aim to reach as much people as possible with this project to get the following word on the street: There is a new jack plug in town which is smaller, flexible and 10x stronger.

 

How you can help

You can help us by getting a perk and sharing the JackSavior story with all your friends. We want to reach as much people as possible so we offer the JackSavior Adapter for cost price, including free shipping!

 

The JackSavior story

The beginning

The design of audio jacks found in modern headphones dates back to 1876 and was invented by Tividar Puskás. It is by no means a bad design, but at JackSavior, we feel that an update is long overdue. Audio jacks break frequent between the wires and the plug. We solve this by connecting the wires inside. But selling headphones makes no sense, as there are already many great brands selling audio products and our founder Bouwy is not Dr. Dre. We are licensing out the technology to these brands but apparently, no manager is interested in preventing jack failure problems for their customers. So we ran a crowdfunding campaign to pay for the first tooling and convince big brands to incorporate the JackSavior plug into their products.

 

What happened after the first crowdfunding campaign?

We shipped all the promised rewards/perks and our goal of convincing big brands succeeded as multiple brands want to have it. They requested a quotation from their factory, who did not give any reply to that request. They said that they cannot give a quotation as they cannot estimate the planning sufficiently to comply with planning rules and involved penalties. This is because they have no experience with making a million JackSavior plugs. We have to buildup to those order sizes and increase manufacturability to achieve predictability for those big manufacturers.

 

Small OEM partner to grow predictable manufacturing

We decided to find a smaller factory to work together and increase manufacturability and thereby the predictability of the whole process. From this factory we will be growing towards the big factories again to ultimately supply to the big headphone brands. We need to produce products to identify optimizations in the production process. This campaign will help us to pay for these production batches and gives you the opportunity to get perks against cost price.

 

10x stronger, no way!

The regular 1876 jack plug can withstand 10,000 to 20,000 swings in an industry standard bending test, depending on stress relief design. The JackSavor plug can withstand 100,000 to 200,000 swings. Find below a video where I try to explain the bending test and show you the actual testing apparatus used in the factory.

 

JackSavior plug in testing device
 

But how?

We solder the wires inside the plug that goes inside your phone. This part is not moving constantly, which results in the 10x better test results.

 

Useful buttons / links

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Summary

For 3 years our best selling marine rated SWAG 6.5" people love, but over the last year we've had a lot of people ask if we are going to make it in an 8" version. Now is the time to see if there is truly enough interest to make them in an 8".

What We Need & What You Get

We need to have at least 100 pair of SWAG 8's spoken for before we'll make a production run of them. In this campaign, for every $200 you contribute you will get 1 pair of SWAG 8's. The normal price will be $250-300 so you save quite a bit of money, especially with multiple pair. If you donate $800 or more we'll throw in some extra goodies to be determined at the time of shipping.

Your Impact

By helping make these available in an 8", you're helping expand the brand and getting as many cars, boats, and ATV's as possible with all EMF Audio speakers. YOU can be the reason we're bigger than ever.

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe the 8" version isn't for you, but you can still help by telling people about this campaign and recommending this speaker to them so they can be made. Share it on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and Youtube. Every contribution gets us 1 step closer, even if it's just telling people about it.

story:
Meet Jackson

The World's Most Versatile Bluetooth Transceiver

Features at a Glance

Jackson is capable of being either a Bluetooth receiver (Rx) or a Bluetooth transmitter(Tx) . When receiving (Rx), Jackson converts your wired audio gears, like headphones, home stereo or car stereo, into wireless with Hi-Fi sound quality. While transmitting, Jackson sends out audio wirelessly from TVs, monitors, game consoles, Desktops, iPods or any device that streams audio signal via AUX port. 

Jackson follows minimalist design philosophy, slick, effective and functional. Full metal frame holds everything together and provides protection from drop or scratch. Card-size and money clip designs make Jackson portable for you to carry anywhere. We are able to keep Jackson as thin as 0.4" even with Brobdingnagian battery inside, so that you don't feel it in the way when carrying around. We determined to make Jackson firmware upgradeable so you can enjoy the latest and the greatest features when they are available.  

One of the biggest pain points for wireless portable devices is battery life. With some sacrifices in design, we are able to cram 1450mAh Lithium Polymer battery into Jackson to provide whole day music streaming (longer with mp3 playing). So no worries about losing power during hiking or bike ride. 

We are serious about sound quality, and so should you. You don't want your high end audio gear to sound crappy when extend it with a crappy amplifier. Traditional Bluetooth adapter does not provide decent amplifier, but we are here to change that by putting in the best headphone amplifier in industry so that you cannot hear any noise or pop while enjoying natural crystal clear music. 

We are the first to integrate microSD card mp3 playing capability into Bluetooth transceivers. Jackson can be used as a standalone device now without attaching to a smartphone, for instance. Collect all your favorite music onto a microSD card, Jackson will play them back for you either in-order or in shuffle, for a very long time. Meanwhile, microSD can be used to upgrade Jackson firmware so you can keep your Jackson up-to-date when new features come out. 

Connect & Control

 

Specification

Accessories

Jackson in-ear headphone

We have spent 6 month, on the side, to craft Jackson in-ear headphone with world's smallest graphite diaphragm. Devil sure is in the details when every 0.1mm counts in design and manufacturing. Even with its unnoticeable size, we are still able to deliver crystal clear sound in all frequencies. Every Jackson in-ear headphone (with Mic) comes with three pairs of silicone caps in Large, medium and small, with color options in black or gray. 

Corbett I S speaker

Corbett I S is TimoLabs best selling waterproof Bluetooth speaker that works well with Jackson. Detailed information about Corbett I S can be found here, http://timolabs.com/speaker/corbetti-s.html

Corbett I Mini speaker

If you would prefer receiving stereo audio with a spatial separation, Corbett I Mini would be your great choice. Detailed information about Corbett I Mini can be found here, http://timolabs.com/speaker/corbetti-mini.html

Timeline

Stretch Goal

 

 

Share the Love

Thank you for sharing Jackson Indiegogo campaign on Facebook/Twitter ! We will reward 20 winners with a free Jackson by the end of the campaign. Please fill out the form for us to consider your entry. Winners will be contacted via email.

Feel free to download our media kit here.

 

Risk & Challenges

As a product company, we are familiar with many possible issues associated with product development and manufacturing. Keeping design for manufacturing (DFW) in mind, our experienced engineering team has worked out processes and solutions to mitigate risks in supply chain logistics, holiday delays and manufacturing timeline during prototyping phase. 

One of the biggest turn down for crowdfunding backers is that they are risking their money and time for something might not deliver. So here we guarantee to deliver Jackson by Christmas 2017 (Rest of the world beside US and China, actual shipping time may vary slightly). And we will offer full refund if we failed to keep our promise. We will keep our backers well informed and updated along the way to make this campaign a smooth ride.

 

FAQ

Please let us know if you have any question about Jackson, either via this platform or through our support email, support@timolabs.com. We will have them answered here.

1. What is Bluetooth protocol used in Jackson ? What is Audio resolution? Does it support Apt-X ?

Both Tx and Rx Bluetooth in Jackson are v4.2, powered by RISC-32 CPU with 16-bit Stereo DAC, SNR>92dB. 

Apt-X is proprietary technology owned by CSR (now Qualcomm), as long as a product is not using CSR chipset, it cannot claim to have Apt-X. And Jackson uses other Bluetooth chip solution other than CSR.

Here is an ancient post about Apt-X and sound quality,

https://www.cnet.com/news/can-aptx-give-you-bet...

2. Is it possible to update to Bluetooth v5.0 via firmware upgrade ?

Short answer is no. v5 offers, 

a. better data bandwidth, which is not necessary for current audio data transmission.

b. longer wireless range, which is really depends on antenna and PCB board level design.

c. naturally support two receiver with one transmitter. We have worked out a solution for this feature on v4.2 as well, but latency is currently not ideal for now (between 50ms ~ 100ms). We will need more backers to have more negotiating power with chip manufacturer, in order to work out a solution from deeper code level that lower latency to less than 20ms.

3. Will it upgrade to USB-C ?

USB on Jackson is only used for charge at the moment. USB-C does provide faster charging speed, but we have optimized battery management circuit to shorten charging time, so we will not shift to USB-C until it is WIDELY accessible. 

4. Does it support DSD ?

No, formats support in microSD card replay are mp3 and wma. 

5. Would it have some lag and losses when Jackson is transmitting audio to Bluetooth device ?

Lag and Loss are inevitable, since it is converts analog audio via AUX to digital, then compress and transmit wirelessly. Certainly receiving Bluetooth device would affect latency, but if two Jacksons are working together, latency is less than 20ms.

Meanwhile, microSD can be used to upgrade Jackson firmware so you can keep your Jackson up-to-date when new features come out. Connect & Control SpecificationAccessoriesJackson in-ear headphoneWe have spent 6 month, on the side, to craft Jackson in-ear headphone with world's smallest graphite diaphragm. Devil sure is in the details when every 0.1mm counts in design and manufacturing. Even with its unnoticeable size, we are still able to deliver crystal clear sound in all frequencies. Every Jackson in-ear headphone (with Mic) comes with three pairs of silicone caps in Large, medium and small, with color options in black or gray. Corbett I S speakerCorbett I S is TimoLabs best selling waterproof Bluetooth speaker that works well with Jackson. Detailed information about Corbett I S can be found here, http://timolabs.com/speaker/corbetti-s.htmlCorbett I Mini speakerIf you would prefer receiving stereo audio with a spatial separation, Corbett I Mini would be your great choice. Detailed information about Corbett I Mini can be found here, http://timolabs.com/speaker/corbetti-mini.htmlTimelineStretch Goal  Share the LoveThank you for sharing Jackson Indiegogo campaign on Facebook/Twitter ! We will reward 20 winners with a free Jackson by the end of the campaign. Please fill out the form for us to consider your entry. Winners will be contacted via email.Feel free to download our media kit here. Risk & ChallengesAs a product company, we are familiar with many possible issues associated with product development and manufacturing. Keeping design for manufacturing (DFW) in mind, our experienced engineering team has worked out processes and solutions to mitigate risks in supply chain logistics, holiday delays and manufacturing timeline during prototyping phase. One of the biggest turn down for crowdfunding backers is that they are risking their money and time for something might not deliver. So here we guarantee to deliver Jackson by Christmas 2017 (Rest of the world beside US and China, actual shipping time may vary slightly). And we will offer full refund if we failed to keep our promise. We will keep our backers well informed and updated along the way to make this campaign a smooth ride. FAQPlease let us know if you have any question about Jackson, either via this platform or through our support email, support@timolabs.com. We will have them answered here.1. What is Bluetooth protocol used in Jackson ? What is Audio resolution? Does it support Apt-X ?Both Tx and Rx Bluetooth in Jackson are v4.2, powered by RISC-32 CPU with 16-bit Stereo DAC, SNR>92dB. Apt-X is proprietary technology owned by CSR (now Qualcomm), as long as a product is not using CSR chipset, it cannot claim to have Apt-X. And Jackson uses other Bluetooth chip solution other than CSR.Here is an ancient post about Apt-X and sound quality,https://www.cnet.com/news/can-aptx-give-you-bet...2. Is it possible to update to Bluetooth v5.0 via firmware upgrade ?Short answer is no. v5 offers, a. better data bandwidth, which is not necessary for current audio data transmission.b. longer wireless range, which is really depends on antenna and PCB board level design.c. naturally support two receiver with one transmitter. We have worked out a solution for this feature on v4.2 as well, but latency is currently not ideal for now (between 50ms ~ 100ms). We will need more backers to have more negotiating power with chip manufacturer, in order to work out a solution from deeper code level that lower latency to less than 20ms.3. Will it upgrade to USB-C ?USB on Jackson is only used for charge at the moment. USB-C does provide faster charging speed, but we have optimized battery management circuit to shorten charging time, so we will not shift to USB-C until it is WIDELY accessible. 4. Does it support DSD ?No, formats support in microSD card replay are mp3 and wma. 5. Would it have some lag and losses when Jackson is transmitting audio to Bluetooth device ?Lag and Loss are inevitable, since it is converts analog audio via AUX to digital, then compress and transmit wirelessly. Certainly receiving Bluetooth device would affect latency, but if two Jacksons are working together, latency is less than 20ms.

story:
We all love to enjoy music, do not we? But we believe that music should not only be heard, it must be seen!

 Our device is a classic visualizer of music from the 90's made on modern components.

The device operates in stereo mode and displays in real time 6 component frequencies for each channel: 2 bass, 2 midrange, 2 high frequency. You simply connect the visualizer to the speakers and USB port and it starts working.

 

Characteristics:

-4 modes of visualization

-Stereo mode

-3 constituent frequencies per channel: bass, midrange, high frequency

-6 visualization towers with 15 LEDs in each

-RGB LEDs

-Built-in microcontroller

-3.5mm jack

-Powered by USB

-No configuration required

 

Sketch of the first prototype

 

Modes of operation

*Look at youtube in the maximum quality of 1080p60 for better effect.

Mode 0 (rgb color, full filling) + full spectrum:

 
Mode 0 (rgb color, full filling) + mirror:

 

Mode 1 (rgb color, single flash) + full spectrum:

 
Mode 2 (white color, full filling) + full spectrum:

 

Mode 3 (white color, single flash) + full spectrum:

 
 

What we need and what you get

We have developed a fully functional prototype and most of the work is done. We need initial investment to organize production. The test prototype was assembled with your own hands, but the devices ordered by you will be produced at the factory using the highest quality components and robotic assemblies.

Our advantage is the price and quality of products.

70% of the proceeds go to production, 30% to further development of the company.

 

Risks and Challenges

We have preliminary agreements with the plant for the production of our products. Within 7 days from the moment of payment, the factory will produce control cards for our device.

The supplier delivers the LEDs 2 weeks after the payment. The final assembly of the device will be carried out by us, in our production at the rate of one device, one hour of working time. We have 5 employees and, accordingly, in one working day we will produce 40 devices.

We will start sending the first shipment of goods in the middle of October.

Our workplace

story:
Watching sports on TV is better while listening to the local radio play-by-play announcer

We're at the mercy of the TV network when it comes to what we see and hear during the game.

Before digital, you could mute the TV and turn up your local radio announcer--the real Voice of the Team--but now there is a delay of several seconds on the TV broadcast. Sometimes this delay is up to 15 seconds and it means that you hear the touchdown, home run, goal or jump shot on radio before the play even begins on TV.

Voice of the Team Radio allows you to delay the local radio play-by-play broadcast so that it lines up with the video on the TV.

 

The Radio Call Is Just Better

There are many reasons that the local radio play-by-play call is better than the national TV announcers, but the reasons mainly boil down to three things:

1) The local radio announcer has called nearly every game for years.  They know the team inside out, and have been through all the ups and downs and wins and losses.  The national TV crew changes for every game and so their analysis is often obvious or off target.

2)  The local radio announcer focuses on the action, while the TV crew has been told that since the viewer can see the action, they should instead focus on analysis, anecdotes and storylines.  With a lot of time to fill, it’s no wonder that much of the TV commentary is uneven, at best.

3)  (Most importantly) The local radio announcer loves our team like we do!  Just like us, they get excited when things go well and they are down when things aren’t going well.

 

Sports Radio Play-by-Play is Alive and Well

Every professional major league sport team in North America has a local radio play-by-play announcer.  Similarly, almost all college sports have a dedicated radio announcer too. These announcers are chosen by the teams themselves and are given titles like “Voice of the Wildcats" or “Voice of the Ground Hogs” or whatever the team mascot is called.

At game time, the team’s games are often broadcast across an affiliate network of smaller local radio stations in the team’s geographic region.  These smaller stations retransmit the game as it originates from the team’s home town station known as the “flagship station.”  For instance, the St Louis Cardinals’ games originate over flagship station KMOX 1120AM in St. Louis, but are then rebroadcast by over 100 affiliate stations across the middle of the country.

Any person within that large listening area can hear the game on radio, but each of them may experience a slightly different delay between their radio and TV.  This difference in delay depends on which station their radio is tuned to, and which cable or satellite provider their TV is connected to.  Also, at times an additional TV lag is added by the network for non-technical reasons, like to avoid curse words or wardrobe malfunctions.

A radio with a user-adjustable delay solves this problem.

 

The Solution

The solution is simple to describe:  Take an AM/FM radio, run the signal into an adjustable digital delay, and then send that delayed sound out through the speaker.  But designing this function to be easy to use with high quality sound at a reasonable price has been a challenge.

After a year and a half of design efforts, we now have a working prototype that meets all those goals.  The prototype appears in the photos further down, but this is the design for the final production version.

Design for the Final Production Version

The Voice of the Team Radio is a solid, straightforward AM/FM radio with enough digital storage to allow for up to 20 seconds of delayed sound with high fidelity.

Allowing the radio user to adjust the delay themselves means that the radio audio and TV video can be sync’d for any situation.

 

Easy to Use

Simply dial in the radio station carrying the local broadcast of the game:

On AM band
(shown on prototype)

On FM band
(shown on prototype)

 

Then, make a rough guess how many seconds the radio broadcast is ahead of the TV and twist the “Delay” knob on the radio until the display shows that many seconds.  If it’s still just a bit off, you can increase or decrease the delay by 0.5 second increments until the radio commentary matches the TV action:

Delayed 8.5 seconds
(shown on prototype)

Certain actions on the TV can often be lined up exactly with the radio sound.  For instance, you can hear the crack of a bat in a baseball game over the radio while watching it on the TV.  When the radio sound and the TV seem aligned, you’re done.  Now you can fully enjoy the game!

Additional Streaming Audio Input Feature
Although not in the Prototype, the Production version will have an 3.5mm Mini-plug jack for input of internet streaming audio from your own device.  This will allow you to delay streaming audio in addition to the AM/FM broadcasts.  The delayed streaming audio will then play from the radio's speaker.

 

Delaying the radio is simple

 

 

Funding

To take the radio to production we need funding for the following:

1)  Layout of the circuit board to factory specs
Our prototype circuitboard does not match the final front panel design.  In addition, the design has not been maximized for manufacturing processes.  These items will require additional engineering work between our engineers and the factory’s engineers.

2)  Creation of factory tooling to manufacture the front panel on the radio

3)  Testing and safety certifications

4)  Travel to the factory
All of our experience has shown that being at the factory when the manufacturing begins is extremely important for verifying that all of the materials and processes are correct.

5)  All manufacturing material and labor costs

 

Meet the Team

The three members of the team have over 60 years of experience in the design and sale of high tech products, especially consumer electronics.

  • Wes Wilcox - Business Development
  • Bob Wadey - Engineering Project Management
  • Charles Roden Rhodes - Engineering Design

 

Risks & Challenges

Bringing an electronic product to life is a complicated task. 

60 years of experience in the industry has gone into the design of this radio.  We’ve maximized the use of common parts and designed the radio using best-practice engineering methods. practices.

With all of our years of experience we’ve seen a bit of everything, but it’s always possible that some new issue will arise.  Given our experience and large networks of people in the industry, we know that if we can’t figure out a problem, we personally know someone who can. 

However, as with all new products, any unforeseen problems could cause a slip in the delivery schedule.

 

Specifications:

  • AM/FM reception
  • Large LED display
  • 3 adjustable knobs:
    - Power On/Off + Volume
    - Tuning
    - Delay in 0.5 second increments
  • Rugged MDF wood cabinet with carrying handle
  • 3” full range speaker
  • Telescopic FM antenna
  • 3.5mm Mini-plug jack - audio OUT (headphones)
  • 3.5mm Mini-plug jack - streaming audio IN
  • Mini-USB power jack
  • Power supply: USB cord + AC adapter included

 

Timeline

story:
My name is Mike Major. I have been a mixer/recording engineer/mastering engineer/producer for over 30 years. In that time I have had the privilege of working many wonderful bands, musicians and artists, including At The Drive-In, Coheed and Cambria, Sparta, As Tall as Lions, Davenport Cabinet, and hundreds of others. I am also the author of the book "Recording Drums: The Complete Guide", and contribute frequently to the website SonicScoop.

The Method to the Mix

I created a video series, The Method to the Mix about three years ago as a way to show the method involved in mixing a song completely, from top to bottom. I felt that (at that time) there was not as much information available to explain the process fully. While the landscape in video instructions has changed more recently, many products on offer tend to lean towards tips and tricks, or how to use specific pieces of software, rather than explaining the thought process and motivation behind the decisions made during a mix.

The number of artists recording at home continues to rise, which means fewer of them are working with professionals in commercial recording studios. This means that many of these artists are left to their own devices when it comes to learning about mixing, or trying to deepen their knowledge about recording, without having access to direct guidance and input.

This video series tries to offer that guidance.

Why Am I Here?

At this point, I have already completed the first 33 videos in the series. I have already touched on how to create a rough mix, how to organize your mixer, how to use templates, and finally, how to build the full drum mix. The first 27 videos have been offered for free via my YouTube channel with still more to come.

With the benefit of hindsight, I now know what it takes to create these videos and would like to carry the series through to completion, but realize that the time involved is significant.

My goal is to complete the rest of the series, which is a daunting task. In terms of time investment, the previous 33 videos have each taken anywhere from 6-10 hours to complete (over 250 hours thus far). To devote that much time to something without some form of compensation, while noble, is not wise, nor is it worthwhile. I do love to help people to get better at recording, but this is my profession too.

So Why Should I Support This?

I have found that creating this video series is akin to what most bands and artists are faced with these days. Their fans love their new music and are thirsty for new songs, yet they do not always feel compelled to pay for that music. The band has little motivation to continue to produce and record music with no chance of a return on their investment, directly. Bands, however, at least have other revenue streams available with live performances and merchandise sales.

I, on the other hand, will not be performing live (thankfully) and don't have any merchandise to sell! I have my experience, my knowledge, and my ability to explain things clearly.

I am appealing to those who wish to support this endeavor, either for themselves or for others that they work with, so I can finish it. I am also appealing to any of you who have watched the videos so far and have gained more knowledge and improved the quality of their mixes. I have over 4500 views and more than 150 subscribers to my YouTube channel, so I know that there is some interest.

There is no set amount to contribute. I leave that to you to decide what it is worth or how much value it has provided to you thus far. All contributions are welcome and will help me continue the series.

The funding will pay for my time and will pay for new software and equipment to help improve the quality of what I deliver to the viewer. I have no sponsors or supplemental support; it's just me. The funding will also serve as motivation to provide new videos to my viewers, knowing that they find value in the content.

And as some of you may be aware of, I am always accessible to answer questions about the video series or recording in general. I am often contacted through my website, mikemajormix.com and I always respond.

I hope to see this video series through, and with your help, we can make this happen!

 

Mike

story:
Every musician knows the struggle of logging scattered moments of creative inspiration.

Toneroll eliminates the need for note taking and frees you up to play your instrument. It does all the hard work for you so you can focus on more creative aspects. Earn a lot of inspiration back and make your songwriting a million times faster.

 

 

Toneroll is designed to accommodate every musician – from the hobbyist to the professional composer. Whether you’re trying to streamline your creative process or just want to simplify it. The app is online and developed to transcribe any musical instrument.

 

 

 

With Toneroll you can just play your instrument while the system perceives and draws your composition over the piano roll in real-time, including single notes and chords. Never again pause to write notes on the paper, never having to record your music in order to transcribe it later.

 

The piano roll grid is a method of graphically displaying MIDI note data, used broadly in DAW and sequencer software. The notes are graphically displayed as bars on the grid, with the increasing time going to the right, and increasing pitch going upwards.

In “edit” mode you can drag the notes around the grid, delete or create new ones. In this way you can finalize your composition and bring your initial idea into completion.

Toneroll comes ready to export your transcription into several file formats, including sheet music and midi. Means that you can utilize your composition through any music software such as Ableton Live, Pro Tools, Finale etc.

  • Export a midi file and get your idea even further.
  • Export a music notation file and utilize it in your favourite scorewriter software.
  • Export audio files if you want to finalize and get your idea into production stage.

Toneroll consists of an efficient but also simple workspace. Τhe UI includes a multi-channel workspace, which is essential for music making. In this way, you are able to add multiple tracks to compose for multiple instruments, insert a track to play along, or even to log ideas variants around one composition.

 

The application is online, meaning that you can use it in your device’s web browser without download anything. Use the app anywhere, with any device. All you have to do is to grab your instrument and start composing. That’s it!

 

 

Toneroll’s musical intelligence is powered by some broadly evaluated music information retrieval algorithms, covering fields from digital signal processing to machine learning, that are released now for the first time in a web application. The application is built over the Web Audio API which is the latest standard for sound on web browsers.

The system analyzes the input audio signal and extracts every possible feature to ensure that it will understand what you’ve played. To achieve this it needs to be sure for when the notes started and ended, along with their pitch and velocity. This information is combined with the tempo calculation in order to build the final composition.

 

What we have so far is a working prototype which is a melody transcriber. This version represents a specific range of functionality, yet it shows a clear promise for the upcoming developments. Check out the prototype version now, and get excited about what’s to come! 

 

Try Toneroll online here!

 

Bringing the official version of Toneroll into life is no easy task and requires thousands of hours of coding, researching and testing. For this reason, we are using a crowdfunding  campaign to fuel this  long  time development process. We believe that plenty  of musicians  around  the  world  are  interested  in such an innovative application, thus with our dedication and your financial and moral support, this project can become reality.

 

 

The best part is that Toneroll’s key feature will be completely free! Every user will be able to transcribe music online with just a few clicks. In order to achieve this, a way to maintain the project and evolve are premium subscriptions that will provide additional user benefits. We need Toneroll to be a self-sustaining open-source platform, and not slowly die when the campaign funds run out.

The crowdfunding campaign is all about building Toneroll v1.0 and releasing it. This is just the beginning. More funding will allow us to start bringing our master plan to life. Our  deepest desire is to create an innovative open-source music making web platform on top of the automatic music transcription tool that we are currently developing.

A platform where music enthusiasts can compose, jam, collaborate, train, learn and discover. A professional musician can easily log moments of inspiration, an amateur musician can learn how to play a song, a music teacher can educate his students, even a music producer can find samples for her tracks.

*We will provide more info as long as we will get closer to these goals.

Our team consists of developers, musicians and audio engineers that got inspired and were brought together by the love for music. We set out to create a platform that all musicians, including ourselves, would use.

  • Markos Fragkopoulos - Software Engineer & Project Manager https://www.linkedin.com/in/markosfragkopoulos/
  • Tasos Adamopoulos - Software & Audio Engineer
    https://www.linkedin.com/in/tasos-adamopoulos-6...
  • Giannis Leledakis - QA & Audio Engineer
    https://www.linkedin.com/in/giannis-leledakis-3...
  • Nikolas Kounalakis - Software Engineer
    https://www.linkedin.com/in/nikolas-kounalakis-...
  • Andreas Stamoulias - Software Engineer Contributor
    https://www.linkedin.com/in/andreas-stamoulias-...
  • Kostantinos Gournianakis - Media consultant
    https://www.linkedin.com/in/kostantinos-gournia...

Toneroll is a cutting edge music technology project. This means that the technology we will use is constantly evolving.

The main challenge for us is to make Toneroll work on every device. This happens because the signal processing algorithms we are using need a lot of computation capacity especially to work in real-time.  To combat this, we will differentiate how the app works in every device according on its performance.

  1. The system will be able to transcribe more than one instruments that playing along?
    At the moment, we will not get in the race of creating a multi-instrument pitch estimation, but one that fully functions with a single instrument in real-time.
     
  2. How accurate the transcription will be?
    Over the past years lot of MIR algorithms have been released out there with free and open-source licenses. Our initial goal is to implement and extend some of them in our web application and get a transcription accuracy higher than 75% for the majority of the instruments.
     
  3. I have an old device, what are the minimum requirements of the app?
    If the device is not from when you were young there are no minimum requirements, Toneroll is able to run smoothly in most cases by adapting accordingly. In weak machines real-time depiction will be disabled because music transcription requires a lot of system resources. Thus we recommend to use the app on a device with satisfactory performance.
     
  4. Does the transcriber automatically recognize the time signature of the performance?
    No, at the moment this is a setting that the user has to take care prior of the transcription.
     
  5. How can I get involved? I want to help!
    During the Alpha version we will publish the first parts of the code in our Github repository. It is very encouraging for us but more for the project itself to get people involved in this effort. If you want to help Toneroll evolve simply contact us at dev@toneroll.com

 

Toneroll campaign credits

John Marinos Maragkoudakis
Anastasia Papanastasiou
Spyros Papageorgiou
Nikos Kontakis
Stelios Petrakis
Eleanna Kazila
Dimitris Tsiprakos
Michael Alexandrakis
Dimosthenis Gousios
Fani Xagoraraki
University of Crete
8 Production Studio
story_txt:
Every musician knows the struggle of logging scattered moments of creative inspiration.Toneroll eliminates the need for note taking and frees you up to play your instrument. It does all the hard work for you so you can focus on more creative aspects. Earn a lot of inspiration back and make your songwriting a million times faster.  Toneroll is designed to accommodate every musician – from the hobbyist to the professional composer. Whether you’re trying to streamline your creative process or just want to simplify it. The app is online and developed to transcribe any musical instrument.   With Toneroll you can just play your instrument while the system perceives and draws your composition over the piano roll in real-time, including single notes and chords. Never again pause to write notes on the paper, never having to record your music in order to transcribe it later. The piano roll grid is a method of graphically displaying MIDI note data, used broadly in DAW and sequencer software. The notes are graphically displayed as bars on the grid, with the increasing time going to the right, and increasing pitch going upwards.In “edit” mode you can drag the notes around the grid, delete or create new ones. In this way you can finalize your composition and bring your initial idea into completion.Toneroll comes ready to export your transcription into several file formats, including sheet music and midi. Means that you can utilize your composition through any music software such as Ableton Live, Pro Tools, Finale etc.
Export a midi file and get your idea even further.
Export a music notation file and utilize it in your favourite scorewriter software.
Export audio files if you want to finalize and get your idea into production stage.
Toneroll consists of an efficient but also simple workspace. Τhe UI includes a multi-channel workspace, which is essential for music making. In this way, you are able to add multiple tracks to compose for multiple instruments, insert a track to play along, or even to log ideas variants around one composition. The application is online, meaning that you can use it in your device’s web browser without download anything. Use the app anywhere, with any device. All you have to do is to grab your instrument and start composing. That’s it!  Toneroll’s musical intelligence is powered by some broadly evaluated music information retrieval algorithms, covering fields from digital signal processing to machine learning, that are released now for the first time in a web application. The application is built over the Web Audio API which is the latest standard for sound on web browsers.The system analyzes the input audio signal and extracts every possible feature to ensure that it will understand what you’ve played. To achieve this it needs to be sure for when the notes started and ended, along with their pitch and velocity. This information is combined with the tempo calculation in order to build the final composition. What we have so far is a working prototype which is a melody transcriber. This version represents a specific range of functionality, yet it shows a clear promise for the upcoming developments. Check out the prototype version now, and get excited about what’s to come!  Try Toneroll online here! Bringing the official version of Toneroll into life is no easy task and requires thousands of hours of coding, researching and testing. For this reason, we are using a crowdfunding  campaign to fuel this  long  time development process. We believe that plenty  of musicians  around  the  world  are  interested  in such an innovative application, thus with our dedication and your financial and moral support, this project can become reality.  The best part is that Toneroll’s key feature will be completely free! Every user will be able to transcribe music online with just a few clicks. In order to achieve this, a way to maintain the project and evolve are premium subscriptions that will provide additional user benefits. We need Toneroll to be a self-sustaining open-source platform, and not slowly die when the campaign funds run out.The crowdfunding campaign is all about building Toneroll v1.0 and releasing it. This is just the beginning. More funding will allow us to start bringing our master plan to life. Our  deepest desire is to create an innovative open-source music making web platform on top of the automatic music transcription tool that we are currently developing.A platform where music enthusiasts can compose, jam, collaborate, train, learn and discover. A professional musician can easily log moments of inspiration, an amateur musician can learn how to play a song, a music teacher can educate his students, even a music producer can find samples for her tracks.*We will provide more info as long as we will get closer to these goals.Our team consists of developers, musicians and audio engineers that got inspired and were brought together by the love for music. We set out to create a platform that all musicians, including ourselves, would use.

story:
Introducing the NASH SoundSmart

 

The Amazon Echo Flex was introduced in 2019. Designed to easily connect every room in your house to Alexa, the Flex allows for voice control where ever you want it. Although it comes with an integrated speaker, it does not offer the performance needed for playing music.

 

At NASH we appreciate the convenience that the Flex brings to the market, but we also love good music when it is played loudly. Whether it is in the garage when something needs fixing or in the shower for a sing-a-long, music lovers need more than what the Flex offers in its standard form. It was so that the idea of the NASH SoundSmart, a simple and affordable clip-on speaker for the Echo Flex was born. Designed with convenience in mind, it does not take up the space that connecting an external speaker does, and there are no cables to trip over!

 

 

What powers the speaker?

The NASH SoundSmart for Echo Flex is brilliant in its purpose and simplicity. The speaker power comes from an External 5W 1.8" (45mm) speaker that replaces the factory-standard 0.6" speaker of the Flex. Our speaker is designed with superior acoustics to allow for a deeper bass, unlike the stock speaker.

 

..And how do I connect it?

Powered by the USB and 3.5mm jack port found on the Echo Flex, you simply click it onto the Flex and plug in the AUX cord, and it will work right away. There is no need to set up a Bluetooth or WiFi connection, simply plug'n'play! *The mechanical design of the mass-production version is being improved and will fit perfectly without any gap*.

 

 

Bringing new purpose to the Echo Flex

The NASH SoundSmart is designed to be a natural extension of the Echo Flex. Ideal for environments where there simply is not room, or it is not practical to connect an external speaker to your Flex. Transform your Echo Flex into a quality speaker and enjoy hands-free voice control when selecting the song that fits your mood! Imagine being in the kitchen cooking up dinner for the family, and you think of that one song you want to hear. Putting the cooking on hold to change the song might not be an option, and why would you when you can simply tell Alexa to do it instead!

 

 

Rewards

We currently have a working prototype. The goal of this indiegogo campaign is to team up with users of the Echo Flex experiencing the lack of speaker quality, to allow us to launch the tooling needed for mass production. With a target of 500 backers this goal will be achieved.

 

Stretch Goal

When the campaign reaches US$10000, we will have the resources to add an additional bottom connector to the add-on speaker that makes it possible to connect yet another accessory such as a motion sensor and nightlight.

 

Prototype Images

 

Who are we?

 

 

We are the NASH Team. We are passionate about the rising smart home culture, and fascinated by what is made possible with the fast progress of IoT technology that the world is seeing. In 2019, we launched the worlds fist Alexa-enabled Stand Fan, and later went on to launch an Alexa-enabled Air Purifier. Today our devices sit in over 1500 American homes and counting, and the positive feedback from our users has been warming. We are determined to continue delivering smart home appliances and accessories that are both competitive in price and features, with the goal in mind to make smart home technology accessible to everyone.

 

Risk Management & Challenges

Our team is experienced in developing smarthome devices as can be seen on our website (www.nash-online.com).  We wish to keep this add-on speaker for the Flex simple and will be using proven technology in a formfactor useful for the Echo Flex. This minimizes any risk of problems in delivering the ready devices by March 2020.
